activities:
Mediaocean as a data controller 
Acting as a Data Controller, we may collect and process the following information:
•	Users’ name, email address and other contact details
•	Users’ training profile, including details of courses attended and courses due to complete
•	information provided by filling in forms on our website
•	Records of correspondence with users
•	Surveys used for research purposes
•	Details of visits to our website including, but not limited to, traffic data, location data, weblogs and other communication data and the accessed resources access (subject to EU directives on use of cookies)
We use Personal Information in the following ways:
•	to contact users where necessary or appropriate
•	to enhance or improve the user experience on our website and/or with our products & services generally
•	to provide users with information, products, or services that they request from us and notify users of any changes to these;
•	to help us keep the information that we hold up-to-date;
•	to carry out obligations arising from contracts entered into between the client company and us
•	to keep user information secure e.g. to authenticate users when using our website or when contacting us by telephone.
Mediaocean as a data processor 
We act only as a Data Processor with respect to Personal Information that is collected, stored or used by our clients. Our sole function is to provide technical support to run the systems on our mainframe and servers for the benefit of our clients. The client company is the Data Controller and is responsible for data protection obligations pertaining to its notification, collection, accuracy, and timely disposal. The client company is also responsible for arrangements to allow users to access their own Personal Information, and for authorizing disclosure to Third Parties.
In accordance with the provisions of Safe Harbor’s FAQ 10 – Article 17 contracts, we have entered into a contract with each of our clients that defines their ownership of all data which their staff enter into our systems. Under the terms of each contract, we’re obliged to process the data only in accordance with instructions from the client. Thus, we’re not required to apply the Safe Harbor principles to this information because the Data Controller remains responsible for it vis-à-vis each individual in accordance with EU provisions.
